column1: NOTES: Base controls consist of child gender, mother's age and age squared mother's age at first birth, child age, country, and year of birth dummies.  Socioeconomic augments `Base' to include mother's education and education squared, and Health includes mother's height and BMI. ``Desire'' takes 1 if the child is born before the family reaches it's desired size, and 0 if the child is born after the desired size is reached. The \citet{Altonjietal2005} ratio determines how important unobservable factors must be compared with included observables to imply that the true effect of fertilty on educational attainment is equal to zero.  Ratio 1 compares no controls to socioeconomic controls, while ratio 2 compares no controls to socioeconomic and health controls. Standard errors are clustered at the level of the mother.
